results.title: Organising discussion groups
results.brief_description: Shows the specific steps to follow in organising an informal adult discussion group. Shows the method of setting up a discussion group an dealing with problems that may arise.

results.title: Organised games in the junior school
results.creator_credit: Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Attico Films
results.brief_description: The film deals with the structure of the games lesson for third and fourth year junior children. The main features of children’s play are discussed and from these evolve the basic requirements of the schools games program. Emphasis is given to the preparation, special organisation and deployment of apparatus.

results.title: Organisation of the body
results.creator_credit: Beryl Denman Lacey, Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and J. Arthur Rank
results.brief_description: Shows, in broad outline, the skeletal, muscular, vascular, respiratory, excretory, endocrine and nervous systems of the human body, and demonstrates the interdependence of these systems and their collaboration in the life of the body as a whole.

results.title: Organics: food for thought
results.creator_credit: Jim Testa, Mike Laker and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs
results.brief_description: Organic farmers work with nature rather than against it, a process of positive cooperation with the soil, without the intervention of chemicals, in order to produce a quality product. Filmed on location in Victoria, this video covers the production, marketing, export potential and labelling of organic produce in Australia. It features citrus grower, Robert Ridgewell; bio-dynamic wheat/sheep farmer, John Greenwood; vegetable grower, Neville Cann and Ian Diamond, organic wholesaler.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jim Testa, Mike Laker and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs

results.title: Organic mass spectometry
results.creator_credit: Peter Griffiths, Michael Clarke, Associated Electrical Industries Film Unit and Viewpoint Productions
results.brief_description: The film shows the comparative ease and simplicity of operation of the MS9 and M12 mass spectrometers. It is intended for scientists, particularly organic chemists and bio-chemists.

results.title: Organic evolution
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: biology”.
Organic evolution traces the development of various theories of evolution. It begins with the Biblical account of creation and discusses the work of Mendel, Darwin and the Hardy-Weinberg law. Examines microscopic and macroscopic organisms, genetics, heredity, cell reproduction, breeding populations, hypothesis and observation. The six episodes are entitled: 1. “In the Beginning” 2. “Darwin, naturally” 3. “Factoring in Mendel” 4. “The Meiotic mix” 5. “The Population picture” 6. “Mutation and all that.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario

results.title: Organic chemistry 2
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: chemistry”.
A sequel to “Organic Chemistry 1”, these six 10 minute episodes expand on the topics in the earlier series. Deals with synthetic fibres, glues, petrochemicals, and the risks and benefits of electrochemical research. Computer animation shows how molecules and compounds lend themselves to a wide variety of industrial applications. The episodes are: 1. “Fibres” 2. “Soaps and detergents” 3. “Glues” 4. “ASA” 5. Cosmetics 6. “Toxins.”

results.title: Organic chemistry 1
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and TV Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: chemistry”.
Starting with a look at the structure of carbon, the atom common to all living matter, these six 10 minute programs investigate the properties of carbon and its fascinating uses - in fuels, plastics, industry and domestic cleaning products. Computer animation illustrates bonding and reactions at the molecular level and simplifies complex concepts for greater understanding. The episodes are: 1. “Carbon the compromiser” 2. The shape of carbon” 3. “Fuels” 4. “Polyethylene” 5. “Industrial enzymes 6. Soaps and detergents

results.title: Organelles in living plant cells
results.brief_description: Shows the appearance and behaviour of all organelles that can be resolved by the phase and dark-field microscope, such as nuclei, chloroplasts, golgi bodies and kinoplasm. Discloses the interactions between the organelles and cytoplasmic network. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description: Shows the appearance and behaviour of all organelles that can be resolved by the phase and dark-field microscope, such as nuclei, chloroplasts, golgi bodies and kinoplasm. Discloses the interactions between the organelles and cytoplasmic network. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Orfeu Negro = Black Orpheus
results.brief_description:
Orfeu Negro is an transposition of the story of Orpheus and Euridyce to the modern city of Rio da Janeiro during the Carnival. It is interpreted by a cast of non-professional actors. Perhaps it was their amateur enthusiasm, the exoticism of the location, or the eventual freedom which Camus was granted to make the film he wanted, but somehow he managed to capture on film the frenetic, pulsating atmosphere of Carnival while telling the moving and poignant story of these doomed lovers. Awards: Cannes Film Festival 1959 - Palme d’or ; Academy Awards 1959 - Best Foreign Film. Best print: X0196.

Credits: Producer, Sacha Gordine ; director, Marcel Camus ; writer, Marcel Camus, Jacques Viot ; photography, Jean Bourgoin ; music, Luis Bonfa, Antonio Carlos Jobim.
Cast: Breno Higeno-Mello, Marpessa Dawn, Lourdes de Oliveira, Lea Garcia, Alexandro Constantino, Waldemar da Souza, Jorge Dos Santos, Aurino Cassanio.
